content.description:
Another fun sport climb up some rock of rather interesting color and texture.

This is a popular place to test your aim.

For more info, see James Garrett's guidebook Utah's West Desert.
content.location: Located on the lower section of rock that sticks out from the main face, near the base of the steep northern slope.

climbs.name: Puffin On The Porch
climbs.fa: Zach G, Dan Dennis and Greg Martinez

content.description: Some thin initial moves ead to slightly gritty slab climbing up high. Like the second pitch of Higher Heights this starts off difficult and eases quickly.
content.location: This route is located on the upper level to the right of a small crack that almost looks like it might be worth climbing. It is easiest to approach this by climbing one of the routes on the lower wall. The most obvious route to get there is Ganja In The Gully. You can also walk all the way to the right and simply scramble to the base.

content.description: Climbs a broken face angling to the right before putting you at a perplexing overlap. Pull through the roof with small feet and a couple powerful moves to finish off with more clean edging to the top chains. Very fun and clean climbing.
content.protection: 16 bolts to chain anchors. Bring a few medium/long runners to keep rope drag down. The route curves right then back left following natural features.
content.location: This is directly right of Greg's Bear Hug and has a nice curvature to the bolt line. Look for bolts right at the roof move.

climbs.name: Higher Heights
climbs.fa: Mike Morris, MItzi Gray and Greg Martinez

content.description: Climb out past the cactus and paddle up the thin edging veering right as you go up. At the first pitch traverse over ~100 feet and look for another line of bolts just right of Puffin On The Porch. This is more excellent edging up a slightly shorter pitch.
content.protection: Two bolt anchors on top of each pitch. Bring about 15 draws.
content.location: The route is the farthest left (excluding Elysian Fields) on the lower wall area and the second pitch is the farthest right on the upper wall area. It's generally easier to climb the pitches separately. Both are excellent in their own right.

content.description: Starts up a flat face and moves straight over a chunk of rock with large holds on each side as well as a lip on the top. Provides a nice bear hug opportunity before launching into some quality edging up higher.
content.location: Starts just a few feet right of Drunk Monkey. Look for the large huggable feature halfway up.

climbs.name: Ganja In The Gully
climbs.fa: Dan Dennis, Greg Martinez, Brian Omera

content.description: Easy edging down low leads to a crux at mid height before a small roof and more broken terrain. Good moderate fun.
content.location: This route is all the way on the right side of the lower wall. If you hike any higher on the right you can approach some of the upper routes with a small scramble.

content.description:
An interesting adventure multi-pitch sport route that ascends some unique color banded, rough, and pocketed rock.

Pitch 1 starts easy following a lower 5.6 angle past a variety of glue-ins and pitons to a 2 bolt anchor.

Pitch 2 is where this route turns on its charm with several nice well protected 5.9 moves to a ledge with a 2 bolt belay.

Pitch 3 was my favorite pitch with several nice pockets and holds with consistent 5.9 difficulty to 2 bolts, chains, and a rap ring belay.

Pitch 4 opens up to a great view of the area as it levels off near the top for a traverse to more 5.9 climbing to another 2 bolt belay.

Descent: Rappel the route
content.protection:
Quick draws and a 60m rope. This route is well protected with glue-ins and bolts in addition to a variety of pitons.

For more info: see James Garrett's guidebook on Utah's West Desert
content.location: Just southeast of I-80 exit 77 at the Blob crags. This is the route furthest to the left on Blobs Your Uncle when facing it from the west. Walk up the trail to the northeast from the large shooting area to the base of some broken cracks. There are 4 bolted sport routes to the right of this route.

content.description: Start by wandering up and left into a left facing corner. Some awkward blocky climbing leads to top shelf edge pulling higher up with a few cruxy moves towards the top. Expect fun movement and great friction on this Martinez crowd pleaser.
content.protection: Quickdraws for 15 bolts or so. Two chain anchor at the top.
content.location: Wander up the bottom of the crag until you reach a hand rope that brings you just south of the start of the route. Several other routes are right near the start.

content.description:
This multi-pitch sport route is another great way to get some traffic in on Blobs Your Uncle. This route has good movement on nice holds up some cool rock and a few ledges.

Descent: Rappel the route.

Be aware of enthusiasts discharging firearms in the area.

For more info, see James Garrett's guidebook Utah's West Desert.
content.protection: Quickdraws and a 60 meter rope. 2 bolt anchor belay with sport clips at the top.
content.location: This route is a row of glue-ins right of 4 bolted sport routes near the middle of the Blobs Your Uncle formation. Scramble up some loose rock where an old rope is tied to offer assistance if you need it. This rope leads to the base of the route.
